title: Elon Musk Buys Twitter: The Big Picture
sub_head: What users, conservatives, free speech advocates and the general public can expect from the Tesla owner’s purchase of the social media giant.
body: Social media giant Twitter jolted the social-media world last week by agreeing to sell itself to entrepreneur and self-described “free-speech absolutist” Elon Musk for $44 billion. The Tesla chief executive has indicated a desire to loosen the site’s content moderation policies, which some see as unduly targeting conservatives, and unlock value that the company’s current leadership can’t. The Opinion pages of The Wall Street Journal look at how the deal came about, why it matters, and how it might change the way we communicate online.
